item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Oh man. I love the fact that you made a Hajime no Ippo analogy! And yes, it totally makes sense. I completely agree that my go ended up being entirely too passive and meek. A part of me does believe that had i played my normal go, the game would have been very very different. Haha. Thanks for the awesome reference and helping me get a clearer sense of what happened!
item.content:encoded: Oh man. I love the fact that you made a Hajime no Ippo analogy! And yes, it totally makes sense. I completely agree that my go ended up being entirely too passive and meek. A part of me does believe that had i played my normal go, the game would have been very very different. Haha. Thanks for the awesome reference and helping me get a clearer sense of what happened!

item.title: By: Moboy78
item.dc:creator: Moboy78
item.description: I read the April Go Challenge think you had a link to on this article, and I must say that I think your idea of being calm and patient ended up (at least for game 2) making your play a bit to passive and meek than it otherwise would've been. I like to think that your moves were like Nao's punches in his title fight with Ippo. You both had this goal in your mind (Nao's was to just have the fight with Ippo and your's was to follow through with the challenge) that you weren't playing as otherwise might have. Although, unlike with Nao, I think you could have beaten your opponent. Hope the Hajime no Ippo ananlogy made some sense. Comeback with 3-2 record for part II =)
item.content:encoded: I read the April Go Challenge think you had a link to on this article, and I must say that I think your idea of being calm and patient ended up (at least for game 2) making your play a bit to passive and meek than it otherwise would’ve been. I like to think that your moves were like Nao’s punches in his title fight with Ippo. You both had this goal in your mind (Nao’s was to just have the fight with Ippo and your’s was to follow through with the challenge) that you weren’t playing as otherwise might have. Although, unlike with Nao, I think you could have beaten your opponent. Hope the Hajime no Ippo ananlogy made some sense. Comeback with 3-2 record for part II =)

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Hahaha. Just the reaction I was looking for. (And the salmon bento box was awesome. To be honest, I think it would have totally been worth $10 if they wanted to charge for it.)
item.content:encoded:
Hahaha. Just the reaction I was looking for.
(And the salmon bento box was awesome. To be honest, I think it would have totally been worth $10 if they wanted to charge for it.)
